channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why businesses banning AI inevitably lose
item.description: Those AI tools are being trained on our trade secrets. We’ll lose all of our customers if they find out our teams use AI. Our employees will no longer...

item.title: AI ‘Consulting’ Services Can Help Smaller Businesses, But Risks Persist
item.description: As with anything related to AI-generated content, it’s important to keep a human in the loop before you act on any of its business advice.

item.title: Sora is even fooling human deepfake detectors
item.description: It used to be that artificial intelligence would leave behind helpful clues that an image it produced was not, in fact, real. Previous generations of ...

item.title: Why multi-hyphenate leaders are the future
item.description: What if the women leaders who were long overlooked are the ones we can’t afford to ignore today. The proverbial career ladder has long been the domina...

item.title: CEO of IT firm with 350K workers says AI will create more entry level jobs—and he’s recruiting liberal arts graduates
item.description: Ravi Kumar S of Cognizant Technology Solutions says AI will widen the base of corporate employment and ‘the path to expertise is going to be faster.’

item.title: Uncle Nearest CEO Fawn Weaver Alleges Smear Campaign Amid Receivership Battle Over $108 Million Default
item.description: Fawn Weaver spoke about her company’s receivership at the Inc. 5000 Conference & Gala in Phoenix, Arizona.

item.title: A Manager Accidentally Leaked Everyone’s Salaries. The Fix Is Simple—But Rarely Done
item.description: When people find out they’re underpaid compared to their colleagues, it’s a source of tension and resentment.

item.title: Simon Sinek says the most successful people in the world ‘hit zero’ or came close to it: Failure is ‘the gift’
item.description: Failure is an essential prerequisite for success, research shows.

item.title: Meta just made it harder to scam older users. Here’s how
item.description: Meta is working to make its apps better for boomers . This week the company announced new UX features designed to deter scammers and make Meta’s apps ...

item.title: Term Sheet Next: Jessica Powell on how AI unlocks the massive enterprise audio market
item.description: Jessica Powell’s AudioShake, already with more than 40 enterprise customers, recently raised its $14 million seed round, led by Shine Capital.

item.title: JPMorganChase made a $3 billion bet on office culture
item.description: “Welcome to the future!” David Arena, head of global corporate real estate for JPMorganChase, is standing on a sweeping staircase in a soaring travert...

item.title: Cambricon a.k.a. ‘China’s Nvidia’ says revenue spiked 14-fold last quarter. The ensuing stock frenzy made its CEO one of the world’s richest people
item.description: Chen Tianshi is the 40-year-old founder and CEO of Beijing-based Cambricon, an AI chip company that posted a monster earnings report last week.

item.title: Inflation Data Could Push Stocks to Record Highs
item.description: The S&P 500 has touched all-time highs following 3 of the last 5 CPI reports.

item.title: How a Free Service Helped This Company Reach $4 Million in Sales
item.description: When Abbode saw the demand for its in-house embroidery climb, founder Abigail Price decided to pull off a pivot.
